title: Establishes a commission to study and develop a plan for improving education in state prisons
summary: Establishes a commission to study and develop a plan for improving education in state prisons.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2315

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. HEASTIE -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Correction

       AN ACT to amend the  correction  law,  in  relation  to  establishing  a
         commission on improving education in state prisons

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The correction law is amended by adding a new section 49 to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S 49. COMMISSION ON PRISON EDUCATION. THERE IS  HEREBY  ESTABLISHED  A
    4  COMMISSION ON PRISON EDUCATION COMPRISED OF NINE MEMBERS WHO SHALL STUDY
    5  AND  DEVELOP  A PLAN FOR IMPROVING EDUCATION IN THE STATE PRISON SYSTEM.
    6  THE COMMISSION SHALL CONSIDER AND INVESTIGATE THE FOLLOWING FACTORS WHEN
    7  DETERMINING EDUCATION IMPROVEMENTS: THE IMPACT ON AN INMATE'S EMPLOYMENT
    8  OPPORTUNITIES UPON RELEASE FROM PRISON, THE IMPACT ON AN INMATE'S  REIN-
    9  TEGRATION  INTO  SOCIETY  AND  THE EFFECTIVENESS IN REDUCING RECIDIVISM.
   10  APPOINTMENTS TO THE TASK FORCE SHALL BE MADE AS FOLLOWS:  THREE  BY  THE
   11  GOVERNOR; TWO BY THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY; ONE BY THE MINORITY LEADER
   12  OF THE ASSEMBLY; TWO BY THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND ONE BY
   13  THE  MINORITY  LEADER OF THE SENATE. THE COMMISSION SHALL ISSUE A REPORT
   14  WITHIN TEN MONTHS AFTER THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS PARAGRAPH.
   15    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.




        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06478-01-1
